alert.note: Alert for Accomack (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 3:02PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Somerset, southwestern Worcester and northern Accomack Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 302 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Tangier, or 19 miles east of Fair Port, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Lawsonia around 320 PM EDT. Marion Station around 335 PM EDT. Pocomoke City and West Pocomoke around 345 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Horntown, Hallwood, Mappsville, Goodwill, Greenbackville, Kingston, Saxis, Wallops Island, Temperanceville and Nelsonia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
